note.p: Death: His home, 79 Wimpole Street, London (23 April 1879)
Education: Aberdeen University; Edinburgh University. MD (1851, Edinburgh)

Career: Physician to the British Embassy, Turin; Assistant Surgeon in the service of the HEIC and went to India (1853); Professor of Chemistry, Bengal Medical College; returned to London (1855); Senior Physician, London Fever Hospital (1861); Physician, St Thomas's Hospital, London (1871-1879); died suddenly
Memberships: LRCPE; MRCP (1855); FRCP (1859); Pathological Society (President 1877)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1879 vol 29 pp xxiii-xxv
Notes: James Paget has signed the election certificate twice
